titleInfo.title: Letter no.1323 of 1820 from James Henderson, Secretary to Government, to Captain William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the receipt of presents from 'natives' by British officials. Henderson states that the Honourable Governor in Council has resolved to abolish the practice of selling presents from natives, and that in future, gifts may be retained for the purposes of being presented as gifts to other natives. Accounts are still to be kept of gifts received.
